Tip 1: Open your windows completely during ventilation instead of just tilting them. Thus, the air in the room gets exchanged while the walls are not cooling down. Also make sure that the radiator is switched off when the window is open.
"Tip 10: Moreover, use the tumble dryer as rarely as possible. Especially in the summer the laundry should rather be air dried. "
Tip 11: Turn off the light in rooms you are not staying in for some time. During the day, the incoming daylight is often sufficient as a light source.

Motivation: Saving energy pais off! On the one hand fewer greenhouse gases like CO2 are produced in the process of power generation. On the other hand several hundred euro can be safed by following simple energy saving tips.
Tip 2: Replace your old lightbulbs with new energy-saving bulbs or LEDs because the latter ones consume significantly fewer electricity by maintaining the same light quality.

Tip 3: Also replace your old devices such as the refrigerator, the stove or the washing machine with newer ones. Despite the higher acquisition costs, a higher energy efficiency class quickly pays off. Make sure that the energiy-efficiency-class of the new device is not lower than A+.
Tip 4: Furthermore, take your own usage requirements into account because too large devices could consume more electricity than necessary, despite a good energy efficiency class.

Tip 5: Turn off all devices not in use, e.g. the TV or your computer. Ideally, disconnect them completely from the power grid, since electricity is also consumed in standby mode. This is easily possible through the use of a disconnectable connector strip.
Tip 6: Do not set the brightness of your screens too high and turn on the energy saving mode to additionally safe electricity.
Tip 7: Make sure that the stove pot you are using is not larger than the pot and, if possible, always cook with the pot lid closed.
Tip 8: Do not set the temperature of your cooling devices too low. Generally a temperature of 6–7°C in the refrigerator and -18°C in the freezer is sufficient. Besides, defrost the freezer regularly.
Tip 9: It is best to use the dishwasher and the washing machine if they are well filled, to avoid unnecessary washings.
Please fill in a consumption objective!
